contentrichtext.text: '''Xavier de Fürst''' is the high administrator of the [[France|French]] government in the [[Wallis and Futuna]] islands in the South [[Pacific]]. He accepted the role and became administrator of the islands on 18 January 2005. He was succeeded by [[Richard Didier]].<ref name="rulers">{{Cite web|url=http://rulers.org/2006-07.html|title=July 2006|work=Rulers.org|accessdate=2008-07-30}}</ref> On 24 May 2005, de Fürst stopped paying King of Wallis [[Tomasi Kulimoetoke II]] his €5,500 payment made by France because he refused to hand over his grandson, guilty of killing a person while drunk driving, to the police.<ref name="times">{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/article525848.ece|title=Island king's cash cut off for letting drink-drive grandson hide in palace|last=Sage|first=Adam|date=2005-05-24|work=[[The Times]]|accessdate=2008-07-30 | location=London}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Furst, Xavier De | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Furst, Xavier De}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Wallis and Futuna politicians]] [[Category:Administrator Superiors of Wallis and Futuna]] [[Category:French politicians]] {{France-politician-stub}} {{WallisFutuna-bio-stub}}
